E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use of water the one which have been recommended in the incision of two wells, and cure that while it is healing.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision of it, cover that you use of needle in the cauterization of it its fear, and the manner of the cautery in it is not but with sharp water, and it is that you stay the head of the patient in your knee, and then press the tongue of it with the instrument the one which we have said, and then take of the water the one which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and make it with that living cause, and stay that not thick nor subtle, and of that fill the concavity of the instrument the one of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Be the extremity of it concavity in which is stayed the medicine as well as the concavity of a spoon of ray, and stay the instrument with the medicine over the boil, and the patient yawns over his latz so that it runs saliva or mucus of the mouth of that by the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not descend of that any cause over the throat of it and that it leads that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then take your hand with the medicine, and express that over the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see that being darkened and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take cotton and envelopes that over the extremity of the ray, and immerse the cotton in the medicine, and introduce the ray with the cotton in a tube of above until the cotton adheres in that tube, and do water as many times until you achieve water that you want of the cauterization of the uvula, and then remove that because it dried and falls about three days or four.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you wished that iterates the medicine, iterate that, and after the cauterization abstergeys in the circuit of the uvula with cotton embedded in border, and modifies with that water that is in the circuit of it of the medicine, and be washed with cold water, and be cured before with embrocation, and dedicate with gargles until it is healing.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision and more long of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with water that is more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured with subfumigation in this manner: take calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, chamomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes, or some of them, in an olla, and be submerged with hot wine, and boil; and the olla be well washed with decent lut, and be in the middle place of the olla a tract, on which be stayed an instrument concavity of Aram according to this manner; be made of silver or of Aram.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the extremity is inserted into the patient's mouth until the vapor reaches the uvula over the tonsil, until the uvula is somewhat obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this moistened procedure until it dries, and be careful not to do this cure at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, because it would too much tighten the abscess, and instead of doing this, you should declare the abscess of it by cautery.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not present to you, then take a cane and on the extremity of it compose a shell of wax, so that the patient's mouth be covered, because the wax shell prohibits the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres in the throat and of the other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Moistened bandages adhere in the throat or a thorn of fish or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, it is necessary that you extract what appears of those, on which you cast your gaze, because you press the tongue with an instrument before the sun, so that to you it is declared what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is to you hidden in the throat, it is necessary that you make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because forcibly the cause annexed the throat is thrown-up by vomit; or that the patient swallows a piece of bread or of lettuce root or a piece of dry bread; or put a piece of dry sea sponge on it, and tie it firmly with a cord, and then the patient swallows it, because when it reaches the place where the thorns are and it is extracted, then it is thrown-up.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And yet take an eel and bind it with a cord, and it is placed and it is extracted; or take a pear and suck the top and suck the bottom.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if it is not thrown-up by those causes which we have said, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be thicker than a ray a little, and in the extremity of it be concavity which you insert into its throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him take his head elevated upwards, and be careful that the touching of his bone of the throat, so that it may be drawn to his body and with that which pushes the bone or the thorn, or that the physician with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But however, that the patient that insert is better, for his knowledge of the place of the annexed cause and pushes in down, and pulls his hand with the instrument upwards, all that according to the quantity which is to him prepared before it is thrown-up.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxxix.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of bloodsucker annexed to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the bloodsucker is medicated with what we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and does not confer, consider then in the throat of the patient to the sun, because you may have comprehended the tongue of him with the instrument which to you we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the bloodsucker, extract that with a small pin or with a subtle gesture decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not to you possible to extract with that, then take a concave cannula and insert that into the throat of the patient, and then place in the concavity of the cannula a burning iron, and do this so many times (until the bloodsucker is dead and it is removed from the throat) and abstain the patient all day of water.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then put a vessel full of warm water, and work the mouth of him in that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not swallow from that any cause and evil the water an hour after with his hand, because the bloodsucker as soon as it feels the water catches.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not thrown-up by what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with cumin or with asafoetida by the instrument which we have recommended in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it falls.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of operation in fumigation of that, is that you take a bowl in which are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and it is composed in that hole the extremity of the instrument; and then let down the fumigation; and place the patient his mouth in the extremity of the cannula, and close his mouth so that the fumigation is not thrown-up until you know that the fumigation has reached the bloodsucker, because the bloodsucker as soon as it falls.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not catch, then you repeat the fumigation many times, and abstain the patient from drinking, and eat salty and spicy things, and do not drink water, and thus necessarily is that with this regimen it is thrown-up.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the bloodsucker of the throat is treated when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as you see, unless that in it there is some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed in the throat, and the extremity of it is similar to the beak of a stork, which is grooved, in which it is sharpened with a file, so that, when we grasp any cause, that does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the discourse concerning abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special matters, of many kinds, according to the remembrance of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their perforation and incision in two ways, of which one is by the nature of the abscesses themselves; and by that which we comprehend of the humidities.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is according to the places in which they occur in the body, for the abscess occurring in the head is different from the abscess occurring in the buttock; and the abscess in the fleshy place is different from the abscess occurring in the joint; and to each of them is its own treatment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more than abscesses are some which ought not to be perforated until the maturity of the matter in them or the completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses which ought to be treated when they are ripe, and not until the completion of them, such as abscesses that are near the joints, for when an abscess is near a joint, its being is prolonged until it can pour out that which is in the circuit of it, and then very often the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, so that it causes contraction of that limb; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it is ripe, it will cause harm to the principal member; or it is near the buttock, therefore perforate it before it is ripe; and do not perforate it crudely, of incomplete digestion, but that which is near the buttock, so that you may not be able to reach the perineum of it and it be prolonged to the parts behind the buttock, and a fistula be made, or that it be done at the term of it that it may not be healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But more you ought to know the hour of the perforation of the abscess, and thus it is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you ought to know that it is ripe when there is the cessation of pain and the cessation of fever, and according to the diminution of the heat and of the pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And that you ought to know that the perforation should be made in the place furthest from the abscess and of pus coming from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the perforation should always be made along the length of the flesh or of the body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the arms or of the feet, and in places of the tendons, of the nerves, of the arteries; and, afterwards, in all places equal in which there is no reflection; for in those which are reflected, use of perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, then it is better that the perforation of it be made until the digestion of it is confirmed according to the completion, as we have said; for if you perforate it before that, it is prolonged the body of the pus of it and of much filth, and very often the lips of it are hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are perforated according to the latitude of the flesh or of the body, as the necessity requires, or according to that which the member indigests.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you ought to administer small perforation, and in large abscesses large perforation and many sections according to the diversity of the greatness of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of abscesses in which the wound ought to be concaved and be incised, when it is made so that it is like bread and made at the term that it already follows, as those which occur in troops of boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those are those which are incised with section having three angles; and of those is the one in which it is incised as the figure of a myrtle leaf, as the abscesses of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those are those in which a round section and a lunar section, and similar to those, are administered.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one to whom there is no such as his abscesses are superficial, you ought to perforate that with superficial perforation, or flat only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And you ought when the abscess is large and has already collected much matter, that you perforate it and do not take that you extract all the pus in that hour; having extracted from it one part, and then close the abscess until the next day, and then extract a larger part, and then do this many times according to the graduation until it is finished.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of feeble virtue, or pregnant woman, or little child, or old man in decrepitude, for the animal spirit many times is resolved with the egress of the matter, and very often the patient dies, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	But guard this chapter with great care, and in the perforation in which you perforate these abscesses, you ought to abstain from the plagues and consider therefore if the plague of the abscess is few, or is a flat section, then you administer the poultices of it or of counter-poison; and if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then you ought to place a cautery in each wound until they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess is incised a part of the wound or you have concaved it in the circuit, then you ought to complicate it with old poultice or with thread made of cloth of it, as when you have treated wounds or incisions, its humidity; and strengthen that within the third day; and then process that and cure it with that which is necessary until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if blood flows during the operation, then you administer cold water and wine to the which you soak a cloth, and place it over the site of the blood flow many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then you must administer treatment and care, and follow the powders that I have recommended in many places in this book and in the division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in wintertime, and the site of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then you must wrap powders in wine and olive oil caut, and place those over the site.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the sites are fleshy, then you must place powders soaked in water and oil or in wine and oil, and all that be cold until the third day, as we have said, and then you must untie the abscess and cleanse it, and administer in its cure what is proper to it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said of every abscess in what manner is the way of its cure by chapters singularly.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xl.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section of abscesses that come in the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head small abscesses, and so of species of nodes that contain tunics that are to their fact; and the species of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of them are pimples, and of those are that contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those are those that contain humidity similar to powder, and resembling to them; and of those are that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you must the exterior of those does not make contrary artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you probe those with an instrument the form of which comes near thus, the which is called entromes, as long as you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if that which contains is humidity, then you split it with a section according to the length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begins in the section of the line of .B. inside the line of .G. Therefore, as the humidity is evacuated, then you excoriate that skin that contains that humidity, and do not leave from that any cause of all, because troops many times return, if there remain from that any cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you submerge the wound in Egyptian enguent, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill with that the wound and leave it for another day, because with that you corrode all that is the remains of that pellicle.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat over that wound with Egyptian enguent second and third time if you need it, until you are confident that there is no longer any cause of that pellicle; then cure the wound with enguent until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the form of a cross, and get oncis between two lips of the section and scrape it from all parts, and exert your virtue in the extraction of the tunic which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your artery makes contrariety, then do what I have told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the stony abscess of section and cure according to what I have told you; and section over a stony abscess is lighter, because it is of little blood and of little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some times there are some of these abscesses that are in the head in some men with whom there is no humidity at all; the cause of which is because I incised upon an abscess in the head of an old woman and retrieved the abscess thus as a hard, rough, white, which could not be squeezed, and if anyone was struck with that, it would plague them.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other abscesses accidents in the head, other than this one, are not this chapter, as well as the abscesses that come to the heads of children and must the roots of the ears, but the section of all these is superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those from the lower part of them so that the body be relieved of the sania in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with what is proper to that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrophulas that happen in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses develop in the neck and in the armpits and in the groin; and sometimes they happen in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that happen in the neck, and are many that are engendered between them, and all scrofula of those is within its own tunic, and as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrophulas are many, because of those some are stony, and of those some contain humidities, and of those are the malign ones that do not obey to cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you see of good disposition in the Touching, of which the color of that which is manifest is proper to the color of the neck, and is mauguda to all parts, and is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not preoned, then you must incise that with superficial siccio from the part below to the part above of the body of the line of .G. inside the line of .B., and scrape that from all parts, and extend the lips of the neck with onci, or with many oncis if you have need of those, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve is not cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, that it does not hurt you with the incision, or that it disturbs the patient, and that you cut only what is necessary to cut; because if you were to cut a vein or artery and you prohibit yourself from your operation, then pause in the plague with crushed vitriol or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and tighten the plague, and leave that inside which you have paused the sharpness of the abscess and the plague is softened and begins to be pus-filled.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation before you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there are any other small scrofulas, therefore cut those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large scrofulous vein, then cover it so that you do not cut that scrofulous from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover it so that you press it with a strong bent needle and let it fall by itself, without harming it.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the plague with old cotton which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut that whole scrofulous, then cover it so that you adjust the two lips of the plague and cure it as soon as pus comes out, so that there is no remaining superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity due to the size of the scrofulous, cover it so that you understand to cut the root of it, and extract it and administer suture and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those scrofulas that contain humidity, pierce them with a superficial perforation where you see the place of maturation of it, and place a perforation for that which drains the pus from the bottom of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer perforation, poultices with ointment and similar things to those, so that it corrodes what is coming from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the plague already cleaned, then cure it with ointment of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the abscess in the middle of the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients said this incision in the groin, and I have not seen any man in our land that it has been done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men having a hernia, cover that the extraction of the groin be avoided, as for that it is not done well for its part because all the veins and major arteries of the body are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses caused in the mouth or groin or both ears, when the illness is not in the canal, cover that you use the incision of the groin to avoid the damage which is done by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, that we incision the groin below three circles of the circles of the groin, or four with small incision for the latitude in that which is between two circles for quantity, that the incision be in ciph, not in the cartilage, and this place is convenient for incision, because it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of blood of it are there.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is fearful, cover that he extends the groin with an incision, and then fends the groin until it reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if he sees any cause of them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incision the ciph according to what we have recounted; and it is signified over the incision of the canal by the flame which is of that which is issued with that which is of its disruption and by the abscess of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, as the hour is remauguda in which perforation is feared, add two lips of the groin of the wound, and stitch that alone if it is the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make flesh grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recounted, exposition is nothing but seeing that some of these abscesses have already opened the groin of the patient, and the patient has come into death, and the vein of it is cut off, and some go to incision the epiglottis so that the patient breathes over the place of the wound by some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that, I command to leave the wound open until the malice of the illness is consumed; and the malice of it is for three days; and then command so the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen with my own eyes, is that a servant took a knife and placed it in her groin and incised with it a part of the canal of the lung, and I was called to the cure of her, and I returned the woman as if she was moaning of the dead, and I uncovered the wound and returned the blood which was issued from the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not incised a vein nor guided it, and the wind was issuing from the wound, and I cured her until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not accuse the servant if not for the rawness in the voice, and after some days she returned to improvement of her dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epilepsy there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision over the abscess which happens in the throat outside, and is called hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called hernia of the throat is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and it moves in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one it is not of healing.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is according to two manners, of which one is similar to fatty nodes, and the other manner is similar to an abscess which is made by a blockage of the artery, and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And no cove that it be made presumption to it like iron, but in that one which is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that one and investigate that one with the finger, and if you find it similar to a fatty node, and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then you incise that one as well as the nodes, and extract that with the water that contains it from the skin and bursa; and if not, then you scrutinize its whole being, and then care for the place with what is necessary for healing before it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the incision of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes there are many species and I have already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And I want to count as the difference between a node and an excrescence as if making a doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that in an excrescence there is heat and fever and vehement pain until the boiling of the superfluity is appeased; and it is complicated putrefaction that at that hour ceases the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But in a node there is no heat nor fever nor pain, and it counts that which is like a lion's mane that is in the sac proper.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and the beginning of it is like a bulb and is made like a vase, whether it is larger or smaller, and they are according to two species, whether they are fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, according to what I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of a node, that you examine it and inquire about it at the beginning with the instrument that is called intromes, according to how it will come its form in the chapter which is close to this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And the manner of inquiry of abscesses and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and introduce it into the place most humid which you find in the abscess, and you revolve your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then lastly your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and then you extract the intromes and consider what is issued in the trace of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the humidity is flowing out, of whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial incision according to what I have said in the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trace of the intromes there is no humidity, then you know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry over it with an incision having the shape of a cross according to this shape:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as I have taught you, and suspend that with forceps, and exfoliate the core from all parts with ease, and guard the skin or sac, if you can, over it and extract that sania with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that sania, and many times it must be done, and then you extract it in pieces until nothing of it remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if from it remains nothing, little or much, the node returns according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that from it remains some small part, then complete the wound with some corrosive powders sharp and strengthen the wound, and place over that which sits abscess caut, and cure that of the other cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then you sew the two lips of it and cure that with what is necessary for healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsatile vein is opposite it, or non-pulsatile, then you cut and moisten the place with three times-distilled vitriol and leave that straight for two or three days until you can scar the wound and that the boiling of the blood is appeased; and then return to incise what is remaining of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the forms of the instruments necessary in incision and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those there are the forms of the intromes, and they are of three species, of which some is large, and of them is medium, and of them is small.

The shapes of the probes are of many types, because of those some are simple, to which there is only one curvature, and they are of three types: large, small and medium.

E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those are having three curvatures, and they are of three types.

Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	Shape of a curved medium probe, shape of it:

Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	Shape of a medium probe having two curvatures:

Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which the section is made are sharp, and the other extremities are blunt, and they are not placed in such a manner, but that it may be done gently in the excoriation of the nodes the fear of incision of vein or nerve, and by those may be healed the disease and restore tranquility a little by the application which brings the excoriation of the abscess.

E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it is in the lateral extremity pointed with a spatula hidden and in that one runs to the inside and outside parts, when you want, as you see.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The shapes of spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers during the perforation of abscesses and do not perceive the ailments, and they are of three types: large, medium and small.
