And then, annex, apply, and decent operation and constriction of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him swear that he will not hurt it during the hours of his vigils and of his sleep, and watch his revolution and agitation, and you must his digestion, and you must all his movements with all his virtue; and wait until the position of the limb is a position with which there is assured pain, which cause is when he feels in the disposition of the position of the limb pain or injury; then you must change it to another disposition from that with which he does not feel pain; and guard with this that the position of it that is straight and equal, so that the limb does not happen curvature when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the tranquil limb is that which I recommend; because you know that the broken limbs are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small as the arm and the finger and the foot and similar to those, then you must the envelope be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are gross as the thigh or the leg, then you must in those be envelope wide and hard, because the wide bandage connects the great limb and strengthens it from all parts with equal constriction, so that in it no macula enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, as you begin, apply your evacuation of constriction, pause ligament convenient to this, over the place of that fracture with three bandages or four according to the limb merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then, look at that to the part more sovereign of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less than not to force the constriction with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then, lengthen yourself with the bandage of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the constriction little by little, until you take from the place a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then, take another bandage and wrap that other way over the broken place with bandage, and then look at the bandages to the part further from the fracture; and be your operation in the constriction of the bandage and in the softening of that according to what we have said in the first bandage above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then, pause between the bandages of wool or cloth with which the tortuosity of the fracture is equalized, if there is tortuosity in it; and if not, do not pause in it any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then, pause over it another bandage, and then bandage over these bandages stars decently made as soon as, if in the place there is no inflammation or abscess caut, and then pause over it what sits the abscess that and that oste the inflammation; and leave it for some days; and then you strengthen over it the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the stars be of the majority of wide cane reed, and well formed wisely; or let them be of pine wood; or of palm branches; and let the width of each star be according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, you must the star that is placed over that fracture be thicker and wider a little than the other stars, and the length of the star according to what is measured to the limb in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen over the stars with another bandage according to your first constriction; and then lie it below with a faithful decent way according to what we have said of constriction, and that it be your constriction according to the place of the fracture more, and as much as it is elongated from the fracture, the less is the constriction.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And that the threads be medium in thickness and fineness, and be of silk; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen in the operation of some fools putting their threads of cords of flax, and it is a great error, when the constriction is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And excessively fine threads are not convenient, because you will not be able to make a constriction with those that you want, and it is not necessary that between the thread and thread there be less than a finger's width.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is said to be feeling the tightness of the threads at the extremities of the limbs near the constriction in those places, then place some wool or carded wool between them so that it does not injure him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture occurs in a plate, and an accident happens in the bone, and I will come with a remedy in that one in the second chapter singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that you should not immediately bind a broken limb with straps on the first day; the reason is that the limb, when it is large, should not be placed on it with straps but rather after about 5 days or 7 or more, according to your safety from the advent of a boil.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the splints with which the Ancients restored, which were placed upon fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of splinting as commonly used for the restoration of fractures, convenient for many conditions and especially for women and children, because it is the one on which no heat nor friction comes; and it is that you take of powdered meal, and it is the medulla of the flour that you must leave the movement of the mill on the sides of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And mix that as it is, unless that you sift it with album of egg, and place the mixture of it not thick nor subtle; and then use of that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to plaster a fractured, dislocated, or sprained limb: Take asafoetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is the root of wild millet, of each one drachma x; of frankincense and aloes one drachma v; alochil one drachma xx; all are ground and sifted and mixed with almond water or albumen of egg if the patient's complexion is delicate; and then use this plaster, because it is of good composition and restores bones that are broken slightly, and confers strength to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way to make a plaster that helps with fractures and sprains: Take migrach and powdered white althea one drachma x; of frankincense and aloes one drachma v; of acacia drachma vi; of Armenian bol drachma .xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All of them be triturated in mortar with much contricio, and be sifted, and be comfit with water or with album of egg and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of splint to joints and separated bones from those places, and if pain occurs in those and in fissures and fractures: take wool suet and be submerged in vinegar and cooked oil and be placed over the place.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	More in this plaster is not virtue of restoration, of boil caut and expelling pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another manner of plaster that restores broken bones: take leaves of fig tree and leaves of wild poppy; conterey all and make a plaster of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of plaster abbreviated administered deserves the restoration of bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remaining boil: recipe of root of althea, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of flour of ers, of all ana part .i.; Be all triturated and be comfit with wine, if the limb is not scalded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scalded, then mix that with moist coriander water or with water and use of it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another manner of plaster more strong in resolution than this first, when accidents hard boil deserves the restoration of the limb: recipe of root of althea and of seed of li, and of balaustia, and melilot, majorana, flowers of violet, of chamomile, of all ana part i engual; all be triturated and be comfit with water of sauze or with sweet water or with wine, all that according to the quality of the limb and the repose of the color of it.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Ipocras does not say in his book that it be placed on the broken limb for the restoration of it but rather made of wax and oil and no other cause; and recommits that it be medium between thickness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But Gualia has seen that be placed on the broken limb for the restoration of it and the causes in which it is exsiccacio with small of heat so as myrrh, incense and resemblances to them of those causes that we have recommitted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster that confers to lesion and pain: recipe of meal, of cheeses, of human hair unshorn or feathers of bird, and of althea, and salt, parts equal; be triturated and sifted and be comfit, and be made plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity according to which the bandage should remain and then be untied, is that you consider if no pain or numbness or the bone is broken, it is not bad from its place, then you do not untie for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if it happens to the place vehement pain or numbness or inflammation, then you must remove or untie that bandage immediately, and place a plaster on it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a cloth of linen and a sponge of sea lion wet, and submerge that in lukewarm water, and with that wash the place until that numbness and pain are calmed; and then let the member rest for an hour; and then place over it wool cloth submerged in vinegar and oil or rose oil, and bind it over it for a night until you are sure of a cauterized abscess, and that the inflammation of the member rests, and the pain of it is removed.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that stricture subtle and small plaster and do not tighten it with your first constriction, and more subtle with that until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and the fever and the pain and the inflammation and all the accidents are already healed of all, and you remove the plaster and the constriction, then you repeat that as you have done at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if it happens to the member no cause of those that have been said, then you do not untie it but for three days or four or five or seven. And sometimes all that is left for twenty days according to what appears to you from the unbinding of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust in the constriction more than in your first constriction altogether, and adjust in the thickening of the food of the patient, according to what is preceded the remembrance of him.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the place of the fracture already dry and thinner than it should, then you know that the nourishment is prohibited from reaching there; and therefore embroider that with lukewarm water you must always that you untie it; and that is in all three days; and relieve the constriction a little, and for this operation the nourishment goes to the member, and it is healed lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what those foolish restorers of the fracture of the member do another time when it is not restored at the beginning, according to what it should, and it is restored according to tortuosity, it is error according to the operation of theirs, and great fear, and if it were a straightener that increased the Ancients in their writings and were agreed with that done.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of theirs do that, because it is more reasonable that it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Second: Of fracture when it happens in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by the blow of a weapon, and the blow breaks all the bones within the skull, which is left the bone, as if it were done in the shaft, and for this reason this species is called ascial; or the weapon incides some part of the bone, and incides the flesh of it and does not pass the incision into the back of it; and this species of fracture is called levitation absolute.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures is either great or small, and of fracture that is compression or attrition; and the cause of it is a blow with a hammer or a fall on a rock, and their likenesses.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating that already approaches the pannicol which is left the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures is either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture it is that it is ammended in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason this species is called capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is made either by a fall or by a blow of a rock and its likenesses, which makes some lamina of the bone enter into the parts within, and it is made in the concave place as if it happened to the wheels of a chariot when it happens to their blow and it is the parting of their entrance into the parts within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mostly it is done this in the bodies of wet bones, as if it were the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And to all these species of fractures, there are pains as if stars separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come with remembrance of all that in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we know all these species of fracture by detection over them and by inquiry of them with touches and examination of corrupted flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary species is known by that which is discovered over the bone, and it is abstergit, and lined over it with touch, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of a fracture, consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by the accidents that signify by manifest signification over pain, as if it were vomiting of bile, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abscess of voice, and syncope, and acute fever, and swelling of the joints and fever of those, and likenesses to them of the accidents in the major dispositions, then adopt that it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see accidents non-current, you hope for health, then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason is that if the afflicted person has come to you at the beginning as he is afflicted and this is in the days of winter, then you should study the state of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then you should study the state of the bone before the seventh day, because that which is left of the bone should be corrupted by the panniculus, and that the accidents that we have recounted may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the panniculus covering the brain, and it is in small pieces and crushed, then you should insert the small and crushed piece, according to what I will recount to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you must shave the head of the afflicted patient, and uncover the bone according to custom and manner as you are able according to the figure of the ailment, and that it be light on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you to detect the bone, flow of blood or abscess, then you must oppose it with what you have, and it is that you fill the place with cloths infused in wine and rose oil, and make the patient rest until the abscess is settled, and if you are sure of the flow of blood; and then begin in the circuit of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two ways of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one way is that you insert the bone with a straight incisor, and this is the form of it: And then administer another incisor this, a little wider than that; and this is the form of it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer the wider incisor than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you should have various numbers of incisors, of which some are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are in the back of the sharpness of their extremities, and are of Indian iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the incisor so that it does not hit the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then you should perforate in its circuit before you administer the incisors with the drills, which are called non-deep drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus, but because those do not reach the term of the bone of the test, to that which is near it, because the drill has a round extremity or edge over that which is left the head of it sharp resembling an edge or a small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of these drills a great number of which as many as convenience to the thickness of each bone,  so that it be to you present in all tests of the brain the extremity of which be acute, the quantity in length and brevity be according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of drills: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the drill on the bone and revolve that with your fingers until you know that the bone is already penetrated; and then change the drill to another location, and pause that which is between all the tract the quantity of the thickness of the ray or around that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert with incisors that which is between each tract of the bone, and make that as subtle as you can on that in the end of lightness, as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or with your hand, or with some other cause for some instruments which you will have prepared for that, as such as tongs and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you should guard with all caution that the incisor does not touch any cause of the ciphrac.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And therefore, as you will have circuited the bone perforating, and if it is continued with it, and you will have extracted that, you should shave and smooth that in the roughness of it of that which is in the bone with another instrument resembling an incisor, but however, it should be more thin and more subtle than the others incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if there remain any parts of the small bones and splinters, then take that with ease with that which you owe you of the instruments; and then take care of the patient with liniments and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other way of operation is lighter, far from pain, which says Gualia and the lauzec for great lausor; and this is the sermon of it: it is necessary to you at the beginning that you begin to discover the part of the bone of the place in which is the fracture most vehement and most manifest, until when you will have discovered that part and you will have placed below it the extremity of this incisor lent and agile of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lenticular part is long and do not insert any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides forward in length, as sometimes; that the lenticular part be adjusted to the ciphrac with the face of it incident acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike upon the incisor of a part with a small mallet until you insert the whole bone with ease as it is revolved, and you are sure of the panniculus that no accident happens to it in any manner, and if the medicant14 were the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	And now if any cause annexed to the bone of the panniculus in some places of bone, insert that of it with the extremity of that lenticular incisor, and deliver that of it with ease, because it is delivered of it its nuisance and its pain.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the panniculus, and what is separated or taken from the bone is its fascia, and it remains in it roughness and subtle satagias, then when you remove that roughness and eradicate those satagias with subtle razors, which you have prepared the number, of diverse quantities so that it is possible for you to administer in every place the most convenient of them and the most right of them according to what you are doing in your operation that broken bone and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And when you administer in your ratio with the razor which you remove the bone at the beginning the most thick of those razors, and then use the most subtle of it, and do not cease to do so according to continuity until you arrive at administering the most thick and the most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any of the other fractures, small capillary and subtle fractures, when you administer care according to what you perceive for the rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is the cause that it is not guarded over all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this is what we have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the panniculus is torn when you remove the bone, then when you take a cloth according to the quantity of the wound, and submerge it in warm oil, and place it over the orifice of the wound; and then take another cloth folded or tripled and submerge it in wine and warm oil and place it over the first cloth, and do this as lightly as you can, so that you do not injure the skin; and then administer over this bandage, and do not tighten it except for the quantity that the wound has alone.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave this with this care for a day or two until you are sure of the abscess caut; and then untie this and administer medicines with which is superfluous dryness, such as roots of linen and flour of herbs, and powder of incense and of aristolochia, and similar to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And that you make of these medicines a powder that is pulverized over the wound, as they are dried; and universally, administer in this all medicine of property of which is that it abstergesca and not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And guard yourself according to your virtue that the wound in your cure be clean; and that there be no in it dirt of washing or other; nor let virulence be added to it; for when it is adjusted over the panniculus of the brain, it corrupts that and you can spoil that, and it happens to the patient according to that evil malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the skin of the head, as from it is modified the bone and most when the cure of it is lessened, and it is black in the surface of it; and therefore consider then if it happens to the patient the accidents that we have said, know that it is pernicious if it is all adopted.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it does not happen blackening but from the medicine that is placed over it, and it is in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackening, then when you take of honey one part and of warm oil three parts. And with those lineys a cloth, and then place that over the skin; and then cure this with the species of cure that convenes until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken but two parts together, or one of those sometimes, for in it you have two bones, for the part left is cartilaginous, and it is not broken and it does not happen to it but attrition and tortuosity and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then when you introduce the said little one into its nose, and that you align that fracture from within with your said finger, and with the said push of outside, until the nose returns according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And be done this by you with facility, and guard yourself that no pain comes to the patient from that your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the most sovereign part of the nose, and the said one does not reach that, then when it is equal with the extremity of the ray in which it is small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the semblance of that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And take care of it in the restoration of it in the first day of the fracture, if it is possible; and if not, then the vii or x of days the rest of the abscess caut.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then introduce into the extremity of the nose a piece of cloth of it, if the fracture is in one part, or put two splints, if the fracture is in two parts, and be in the splint thickness of such quantity that it fills the trough of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And I say some of the ancient restorers that the splints are enclosed in butter, and are changed every day, but it is not seen to me; it ought to be that the piece is enclosed in album of cooked egg with powder of moly; and then leave the which one until the bone is set and the cartilage is hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes it is introduced into the nose, in place of splint, a pain of hawk pus that is enveloped in cloth of lion; and be that already you have the fracture of the nose more vehement and that the patient is not prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary to you; and if you want, do this, and if you want, do splints.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another abscess occurs after cautery, apply a poultice of cerot or coto infused in vinegar and rose oil, or diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if no abscess occurs after cautery, then you must apply a poultice to the outside with sesame flour and powdered incense, mixed with egg white; and place a linen cloth over it, and do not touch it with any cause.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are crushed, then you must cut over them, and extract them with instruments that are suitable for them; and then close the incision, and treat it with water that heals and consolidates, and with suitable plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if a plague occurs in the nose, then you must treat it with poultices and administer lead pipes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture of it is not with a plague, then observe if the fracture is only outwardly, and is not broken in two and is curved at the parts inside, then its knowledge is lighter.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then you must introduce your left index finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left mandible, then introduce the index finger of your right hand; and push with that the inward flexibility of the fracture with ease to the outside parts, with your other hand from the outside of the bone; and with this decency equal them.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated in two, then you must administer extension of two parts according to rectitude until it is possible the equation of it.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there occurs commotion of teeth to disruption, then strengthen those of which you hope will remain with a thread of gold or silver or lead; and place a cerot on the broken mandible, and place a double cloth over it, and place over the cloth a large splint made decently, or a piece of sole equal to the length of the mandible; and tie that bandage according to how you have prepared the ligation of it and how you deem the application, until it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use rest and tranquility, and place their food soft and lean.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that the figure has already been altered in any manner, then you must remove and untie that on the third day; and then rectify what has already been altered of it and apply a poultice of powdered moss, egg white, or sesame flour, because you will have removed the cerot from it, and place over the poultice a linen cloth.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And therefore, as it stands attached and adjusted that poultice over it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave it, that you do not untie it until it is healed and strengthens the fracture; because many times this fracture is straightened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another time an abscess occurs after cautery, then administer what we have said many times in the sedation of it until it is healed, and the abscess is removed.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with a plague, then consider if it is a piece of bone separated or splinters, then you must subtilize that you remove those splinters with what you deem suitable for their removal with instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the orifice of the plague is strait, then you must enlarge it with the fleubotomist according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you will have removed those splinters, and of those nothing is removed, then you must close the orifice of the plague if it is wide; and if not, place over it one of the poultices that you deem suitable for it and heal it, until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the clavicle when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the clavicle is broken at the part in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken, or separated, or is separated in two parts, the other which do not occur splinters; and it is easy to the restoration of it; or it is so that it occurs splinters in it, and it is difficult to the restoration of it; or it is so that the fracture is with a plague.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that, when the fracture is with a plague, is that you make two ministers be present, so that one holds the adjutori and follows the broken clavicle, and the other extends the neck with that part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then engulfs the fracture with your fingers until it is made the form of it according to what you deem, and that there is in it little eminence nor concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you deemed more extension, then you must place under the patient's shoulder a support of cloth or wool, and be the size of it according to the quantity of your need; and extend and elevate the clavicle and hold the support with your hand until you engulfs the fracture according to what you deem.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot pull the extremity of the clavicle to the outside parts, because it is reached to the preon, then you must make the patient be supine on his neck, and place over the muscle of it a cushion of medium size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses the muscle of it to the lower parts while the bone of the clavicle is elevated that is in the preon in it, and then you rectify the fracture and engulfs it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel pangs in the collarbone and it hurts, then place your hand on that area and extract those pangs with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then your ingenuity makes an incision of it with one of the scissors which you have prepared for this purpose, because you have placed under the collarbone the instrument that serves the head; and it is a tool of wood or iron, of which this is the form:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a spoon of which this is the concavity; and its width according to what you have need of it, according to the size of the bone or the smallness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it be according to what is possible to you in the operation; that it have two extremities thus as sometimes, and one extremity be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the plaque which you have incised when you have extracted the pang from the bone is wide, and it is certain of pus caut, then you adjust the two lips of the plaque with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is small, or you fear pus caut, then you fill the plaque with cloths and powders according to the quantity of the scissure of the plaque.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if pus caut occurs, then you put a cloth in vinegar and rose oil and wine, and place it over it.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the stricture of the bone when it is its plaque and its section, is that you place a plaster made of flour of wheat with egg white, and place on it linen cloth, and then place the sphere under the little bit of it, if you are in need of that, and then take humidity, so it is the which has the Saracens, that it be very long, and its width of it be of one palm or around that; and then place double powders on the linen cloth and the plaster; and then take a piece of thin board of which the width of it be of three digits and in length similarly; and then wrap that in cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the board in the place over the place of the fracture; and then place humidity as it is revolute, and roll that over the neck of it and under the little bit of it of the patient, and reduce that over the whole part, and sometimes that the stricture of the fracture with stricture descends, and this is what is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all, that the board be not harmful over the broken bone; and for so that you see the patient every day, that when the ligament is softened or you see the board already being remauguda, then you rectify that and strengthen the ligation.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the sleeping of the patient on the neck of it, and place under the little bit of it of it during the night a small cushion; so that with that it be elevated the helper of it from the side of that, and therefore is elevated the fracture of the collarbone to elevation of the muscle; or be the arm of it tied to the neck of that.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not untie the ligation if you do not occur in the place precisely or the pus, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen the face of it to that, and adjust in the stricture and restore that and leave it until it is restored and coagulated the fracture of the collarbone.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the month in twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some men it is done in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula tart is broken in the side of it and not broken of it but the edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken the place of it — and it is broken in the middle place of it — and it is not known except by touch, then according to what is the figure of the fracture forces you the preparation of it and reduce that according to the natural figure in every manner of engine which is to you possible.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place on the place flour powder with egg white and linen cloth; and then place powder of cloth duplicated; and then place over it a board made of thin board according to the quantity of the spatula whole or maybe a little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the board is concavity in some of the places of the spatula, then you fill that concavity with linen cloth, and then put the board according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen under it with long humidity with constriction decent and firmness of the board until it be not remauguda from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the ligation every day; and every time that it is softened, tie another time and strengthen it and equal the board if it is remauguda from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the patient on their side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or in twenty-five.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when this number is complete, then you dissolve the ligation, and that you know for sure that it is of the bones of which the beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the place of the bone's weight and put under the shoulder, then you split over it, and take it out, and do according to what we have said in the fracture of the collarbone of the discharge of pus caut if it occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of the fracture of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot sometimes is broken in the middle part of it and that is very bad; but the extremities of it must be moved that they are cicatrized and comminuted.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of it when the middle of it is broken it is that it declines to the parts of it and happens to it great pain, and difficulty in breathing, and cough, and strong fever and vomiting of blood; and it is declared in it cavity in the broken bone and is not hidden to the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that it be laid the patient on his back, and place between his shoulder blades a cushion; and then press on the muscles of it, and adjust the bones of it with the hands of two sides, and subtly in the operation of it and in the equation according to every manner that is to this possible and that convenes to this, until that returns the figure of the bone according to that cove.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place on it plaster and tow and place above the table a subtle sheet of gauze or of caligi and of their likeness in levitat, because that you envelop that in cloth; and then subtly in lian that over the broken bone that it not be harmful; and go am liadure according to roundness to the back sometimes, and strengthen that am stricture decent; and then consider the liadure in every hour, and when it is softened strengthen that.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity provokes the desliament of that, you must corrode or pruziment, the pain, the abscess that happens in the place, then you cut and untie that and eradicate the plaster and rectify that which happens by that in manner of cure of it; and then reduce the plaster, if times to that the face; and adjust to it stricture until that it be sanat.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the back when it is broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that fracture of the back does not catch but in places thick that follow the back; and of the extremities of them of the part in front, it does not happen to those contricio but because that they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And knowledge of it is not hidden to the feeling, therefore the inquiry of it with the said.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is such that align the fracture with the said according to the manner possible, until that it be aligned according to that cove, and then plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel, if it is indigenous of that.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the back is declining to the parts of it, then happens to the patient great pain and puncture, as well as puncture that happens to him who has pleureci, and because that the bones put the veil; and happens to it difficulty of hanelit, and cough, and vomit of blood; and this is of difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Ancients so ingenious in that with motz engientz.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And of them it is said: cove that you put foods of the patient that engendered inflation and flatulence, because the belly be inflated and be extended, and the fracture be impelled to the parts outside.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we would not advise that because that it not be cause leugiera to generate abscess caut, if it does not happen; and if it already happens, then it already helps to that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they said some of them that it be laid upon a ventouse and then that it suck with force; and it is seeming to ratiocinacio, but however it is feared that the ventouse drive the superfluities to the place by the weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they said some of them: cove that the place be covered with wool that already is submerged in hot oil, and that pulvils be placed between the ribs until that it be filled, that it be the liadure aligned when it envelops that according to roundness; and then be cured the patient with cure of pleurisy of food and of medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if cause vehement constricts the patient the which does not suffer, and the bones put the veil with puncture ledent, fear over the patient, then cove that they cut over the place, discover of the broken rib, and then place over that instrument that conserve the ciphac, the remembrance of which is preceded, and that they cut the bones with facility, and extract that.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then that they adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is great, with sewing, and cure that with plasters until that it be healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it happens of it abscess, then you cut and put pulvils in hot oil and place over the place, and that it be cured the patient with that which cove to the abscess of it.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And be laid on his back upon the which he sleeps, until that it be healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fracture of the vertebra of the back and of the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes it happens fracture to the bones of the neck, and it is very bad to their attrition, and seemingly to the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And as that happens to some and you want to know if it will heal or not, then consider, because if sometimes their hands already softened and stupefied and dead and cannot more those nor extend nor strengthen those and when you constrict those with your said or prick those with needle and no feel in those pain, then you know that it is not healed, and in the worse of dispositions it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if those and feel in those constriction with the said and puncture, then you know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the patient will go with cure.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see in the neck vertebrae the appearance of this and want to know if it is healing or not, then consider the feet of him.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you see that they are already softened, accidies to those humors that are happening in the hands, and as soon as you put your hand on their back, you feel wind and digestion, and sometimes it is raised on its back and wants to urinate and cannot, then you know that it is mortal, and therefore do not work in the cure of him.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if you do not see any cause of those, the cause is better and less severe.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the cure of him is that you perforate the seat of the abscess with a cautery, and you put on the affected vertebra olive oil rubbed with salt, or with mugs of hot water; put on that area several times a day until the abscess is cauterized.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then put one of the comforting and existing plasters, and strengthen it on that with a bandage; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility and that he does not sleep on the part with which he feels pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the separation of the bone from the cartilage or any cause that is already separated from it, then cover that with a bandage and that you hold that bone; and then adjust the two lips of the wound, with suture if it is large; and then cure it with some kind of ointment of the surgeons, until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the tailbone is broken, and it is the end of the spine, then cover that with a bandage and that you hold that bone with the other hand according to what is possible by equation second; and then put on it a plaster and bandage, if you need those, and then strengthen that.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel cartilages broken in it, then cover that, and hold that, and cure the wound with the cure that is preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the  anus.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the anus are broken, and if they break, then the fracture of them is nothing but a communication in the extremities of those and they are incised in the length and decline to the parts of the intestines; and if it happens to the patient pain in the place and puncture, and the leg is stunned when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over it until it is over the fracture as is the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is in the extremity of it only, then you engage that according to how it is fitted to you by equation engage until it is assembled to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the long one or that already declines to the parts below, then you make the patient lie on their belly until it is prepared to you the restoration of that fracture.
