E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And therefore when you have engaged it, put on it a plaster, and then put on it a bandage of cloth or of bandage, and strengthen by stricture over which you do not fear puncture of fracture nor removal of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And engage the concavity with water that fills it until that presses the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on their back or over their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if you see abscess cauter, then you cease from extension of it and its restoration until the abscess is cauterized, and put on it water that sits it according to what is preceded; and then return to the restoration of it, and strengthen it thus as you cover.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if you see in the cartilages or they are comminuted, then you put them together.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the  arm.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	Arm is that which is between the shoulder and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then the restoration of it is in one of two ways, of which is the one that you take a stick of medium thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And there are tied at two extremities two bandages, and then it is suspended from the elevated place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a stool; and then throw out his broken arm onto the stick until it reaches the tip of it in the middle place of which is annexed the curvature of the stick.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then hang on it some heavy cause, or the minister extends that to the lower parts; and then the doctor and that the fracture with his hands together, until the fracture returns according to what is covered.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient be raised on their neck and suspend the arm of his collar with a bandage; and then command two ministers that one of them holds that which is above the fracture with his hands; and the other holds the pus below of it; and each of them extends to their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you strengthen over the fracture with a bandage and over that with another bandage, and each of the two ministers extend to their two parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And therefore if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then cover that the half of the bandage is put on the citillic and the other below the fracture of the joint.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is close to the joint, then cover that the bandage is put on that place and on that joint.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Gently guide her with ease and her work, and as soon as she is well-guided according to what is convenient and applied properly, then strengthen her if no abscess occurs after cautery.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an abscess occurs after cautery, then leave the stricture for seven days, and place upon it wool soaked in vinegar and rose oil until the abscess heals, and then you strengthen her.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to strengthen her is that you place a plaster on the fracture, and then place a wrapping of new cloth over the plaster; and then adjust the arm on that support, and place your hand open on her muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and strengthen over the support the arm so that the arm be in place of stars, if no prohibits this any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use of stars.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place on the fracture that star that is pus wide and pus strong of the other stars; and place between each star the width of the finger, and be the length of the stars according to the fracture with addition of three fingers of all part.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen over the stars with the stricture which I have said at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your stricture over the place of the fracture be pus straight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as much as it is elongated the fracture be the stricture lesser.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore if you see the situation of the stars and the stricture as we have said in the hour in which you restore the limb to its situation, then you do.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear abscess caut, then you leave the stricture and the stars for seven days as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that no abscess occurs in the place proximate or inflammation; or it is prohibited the food to arrive at the limb by disposition of superfluity of stricture; and therefore rectify all that according to what we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are on confidence that no cause of this occurs, then do not untie the bandage until after three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And be the sleep of the patient on his back, and his hands on his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place on the support a cushion full of wool well-guided, and consider in all hour of the night or of the day that not be undone nor dissolved the figure of the broken limb, or that be the ligament softened, therefore rectify that all with your virtue.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And place the food of the patient according to the order which we have said before, in such a way that the food be subtle in the beginning until it is begun to strengthen; and then when it thickens the food of him.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	For of custom of the support and of the bed of him is that they be strengthened for 40 days; and then when they be untied and be administered bath and be medicated with poultices those which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is laid rubbed, then you do not untie of that the bandage and the stars for a day or for two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones which are called two focils; of which one is small, and that is the one that sees the finger placed, and the other is great and that is the one that is placed below the little finger, from the part further back.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And strong there is broken the greater focil alone, or the little one, and strong there are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when is broken the little focil above, then the restoration of it is lighter, and the healing of it is lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when is broken the focil of it below the fracture of it is bad, and the healing of it is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse of that is when the two bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone which is broken is the little focil above, then it is convenient to the physician, must the restoration of it, that place small extension with ease until that be well-guided.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the great focil is that which is broken, then it is that you place extension more vehement.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if the two focils are together broken, then it is that you place the extrication more strong.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And how you place the figure of the hand, you must the restoration of it and the extension of it extended over a cushion, and be the wrist of the hand to the parts above, more high than all the other fingers, and the little finger be lower than the other fingers, and the patient be centered on a fallen cushion.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And be a cushion in front of him in the height or straightness of him, so that the patient not incurve work.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then the minister extends the arm from the part further back with his hand or ligament, and another minister extends above seemingly.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the physician guides the bones while reducing that according to the best figure that it can.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the facture of the bone there are splinters, then you pierce to reduce all that in its place with your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if appears in it splinter separated that punishes the bone and is not to your hope in the restoration of it, then you finish upon it and remove that according to the manner which we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with a plaque, I have already made a singular chapter about it, and therefore take the cure of it.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then line a cloth with cerate made of rose oil and white wax, and make it between subtlety and thickness, and tighten the cloth over it with a subtle structure until the abscess is yielded; and then remove the cerate and place a prepared plaster of powdered flour mixed with egg white, and place stars; and let the star be the one placed over the fracture, pus laider and stronger.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And know that the name of the stars of the arm is seen in the greatest arrangements, or whether the fracture is in one focus or in two foci together.

And place your structure over the place of the fracture, stronger and more vehement, and as much as the constriction is above the fracture or below it, place the constriction a little more soft according to how it is preceded the recollection of it in the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are enveloped over the fracture be soft and moist cloths, and not hard or rough, and the thread with which it is tightened be of the proper measure between subtle and thick, as we have recounted.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the limb and the joint near a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause occurs for which rectification is necessary, as prudently as the one that occurs to the limb, and then cover that you embroil the limb with warm water until that prudence ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And let the limb not be constricted until it rests, and then return the constriction.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the constriction is already softened and the bone is already remade and seems to those, then rectify all that with your virtue.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider more if the nourishment is prohibited from reaching the limb by superfluity of constriction, for then cover that you soften it a little and let it for a few days until it runs to it the nourishment, and then tighten it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if the patient does not occur any cause of those that we have said, then cover that it not be untied within about 20 days or thereabouts of those.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And then let the hand of the patient be suspended by its virtue of agitated movement, and make him sleep upon his back.

And know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or 32 days, or strong it is restored in 28 days, and all that is according to the disposition of the complexities and the dispositions of the virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.

Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the bone of the hip.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the hip many times is broken and is declared to the feeling according to how it is converted to the front part and to the most sovereign.

And then leave the splint on it, so that it does not occur to the limb corruption or abscess, or swelling, and similar to those; and if any cause of those occurs, then cut you from it, and rectify what has occurred again, as we have said many times.

But if in the bone is a piece of the bone which puts, then cover that according to what is possible to you; and if not, cut on it and remove that, and cure with that of which is preceded the recollection until it is healed.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.

Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the talus and of the bones of the foot and of the digits.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio. Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of fracture of the hip of the woman and of the bone of the pubis and of the groin of the man.

E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do so for vii days or around those, because that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you want, take a bladder of sheep and strengthen over the track of her a tube of cane; and introduce all the bladder in the hip of her, and then insufflate in the tube with virtue within that the bladder be inflated within the hip, because the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then be filled with cloth and stay for some days according to that we have recounted, within that it be healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the pubis of man or woman is broken, then administer in the restoration and stitching of it that which we have recounted in the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is right is not hidden in these proper fractures and which few understand, especially to him who has some study and use and understands this my book word; for that fracture signifies to you in the major dispositions via of the straight in the restoration and in the stricture of it, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the man's groin when it is broken, take gauze of oak, and put the groin in it; and then place a cloth wrap over it, and be wrapped, and then be left for three days or around those, and be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of fractures of the bones when it is with a plague.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient to him to whom accidents fracture with plague, and more so if the bone is large as is the bone of the hip or the humerus, or similar to that, that you take care and flebotomize that as soon as the conditions of flebotomy to you or testify as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the plague flows blood, then you must take care to the retention of it as much as you pulverize over it zig zag, if to you another cause is not present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture in that same day, and do not prolong that, if you do not happen abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess happens, then you leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess is given, and do not approach it on the third day and the fourth of all, for you will make happen bad accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is eminent over the uncovered hip, then you must perforate to reduce it and equal it with your hands with facility and with little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not to you prepared and the equation of it with your hands, then you reduce it with your hands with this instrument; and the instrument which is made of iron, the length of which is of seven digits or of eight and the width of which is according to the quantity of the plague; and for that it is necessary to the physician that he prepares of those three or four according to the quantity that indicates to it in the cure in all species of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And be round, and be in it little thickness so that it not be bent of the compression over it in the hour of the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And be of acute extremity at which be margin in its extremities; and be the use of it to thickness tending, and of the majority of it within to the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called in Greek “labre volentz atelarem”, so it is a little palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	For that it must be placed the extremity of it attends elevated over the extremity of the bone eminent.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And impel it in one movement until the bone returns, and be equalized with some equation.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore strive to equalize the extremities of the fracture between them, and if the extremity of it broken is subtle, and does not take that the instrument for good acceptance, then you must insert the extremity of that bone until the instrument has power of it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone of all with that which we have recommended, then incisions it with that which convieneys to it of the incisors which we have said; or saw it with one of the saws in any manner that be to you possible.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then ratz that which remain in the bone of asperities and of small scorcas.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And as the bone is reduced, and after the reduction the patient suffers vehement pain leading, then you know that the bone is not returned to its natural place; and therefore do that which you confer to the patient great benefit.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	As it is completed your restoration which you make to the bone, and then submerge cloth in black styptic wine, and properly if it is in summer, and do not place over the plague cerot nor other cause in which be oil, so that it not make in it happen  poudred and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stelas in the hour of your compliment of the restoration of the bone, and leave the plague uncovered as much as you incisions the tract with forceps and uses of bandages according to the quantity of the plague.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And guard yourself with all caution that you do not strain the plague with the fracture, for many times have done that the foolish physicians, and have made happen over their patients death or illness corrupt or violently, so it is healed.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your stricture lighter, soft, diverse from the stricture of the other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the plague is great or is bad plague, and you fear over it some accidents bad which we have recommended, and you suffer pain in the place, then you must not place over it stelas, but make to it wrapping of hard cloths in place of stelas and strain it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And as soon as one day or two times already the plague begins, that in it be engendered brac, then you take off from it the cloth which you had placed over it with wine, and then administer calques, engentz with which of our custom is that we medicate the plagues, as engentz tetrafarmacon and similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And convieneys to you that you untie the bandage and consider the plague in each day morning and evening until it be consolidated and fixed, and that the member be prepared in such manner that the poudered run from it to the parts below with facilitated.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague lasts many days, and the arm is not consolidated or separated from it, then you know that here are satagias of the small ones so that you can inquire about the plague with a tenta.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those satagias, those that are separated they remove and extract, those that from them are not separated and put the member and make them have pain, pierce you to incisor those according to what to you is possible.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if it happens to the plague a suppuration or elephantiasis, it is a kind of corruption and putrefaction, then you must put on each of those with what convenes to them of the cure of which is preceded the narration in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of this in which you must know the best speech and you make present your own: when the bone is broken, elevate the member as the bone of the thigh and the auxiliary and similar to those of the large members, and that you do not presume to traction of it, nor the extraction of it for many times it happens through this death; have left that within that you can, for very soon it will fall by itself about twenty days or thirty. And then cure the plague if to you is seen, and if not leave that.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .xx.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of nodules that happen in the trace of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this nodulation happens in the trace of healing of a fracture, and mostly that it is near the joints, and it is disfigured by it the figure of the member; and very soon prohibits the member of its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore, consider if the nodulation is recent and administer in that medicines that have styptic as such as aloes, and incense, and mira, and scarce, and acridity, and similar to those; in this way that you take of that some or all, and combine those with styptic wine, or with egg white, or with vinegar, and place that on the nodulation in a bandage, and bind those on it for good constriction.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And leave the constriction that do not untie that for many days; and then untie that and iterate another, until that the nodulation is healed; or strengthen on that a lamina of lead descentment, for lead has property to heal all that is inflated in the members.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the nodulation is already in a worse converted and tightened is and necessity provokes to take out that coitadament, and then cut that by the part most sovereign of it, and incisor the superfluity and elevate, or rat that with some rezoris until that it is healed; and cure that until that it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of restoration of fracture when it is restored and then what remains the member subtle and frail not according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is restored, and then what remains the member subtle and frail, then that is not done but for many causes: of which one is multitude of solution of the ligament and of the ligation of it made not according to what is coven; or for superfluity of constriction of the ligaments until that the nourishment be prohibited to run to the member; or for multitude of superfluous embrocation; or for superfluous movement not in its hour; or for scarcity of blood in the body of the patient and for weakness of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And cure of that is to give to the patient to eat less and make his heart tender until that the blood be multiplied in him; and administer baths; and intermingle joy and happiness on him.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then place a poultice on the member, so that the poultice attracts to it much nourishment, or continues embrocation of it with warm water, until that the nourishment runs and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .xxii.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the cure of the broken bones when they are restored crookedly and prohibits the operation of them of what is coven.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When it happens to the member already restored the healing of it from crookedness and eminence to the broken bone and nodule, and it is for that feared the form of the member, but however the member is not prohibited of its natural operation, then you must not receive the word of that one who exists that member be of new broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But already so many foolish physicians and restorers the ones who have done that in our land; and this operation is very vituperable, losing a great fear the sign of which is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if lameness and nodulation are recent, then you must have them embrocated with warm water in which are put softening herbs, such as are the flowers of altea and roots of it, and melilot, and similar to those; and be made a plaster with softening plaster as diallagulon well made; or that be taken a poultice of roots of altea and be contused with gray of guanine or with olive oil, and be plastered with that; or that be taken fig leaves fat and be crushed with dove's dung, and similar to those of the medicines that are called amermans consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some times it is dissolved with assiduous friction lighter that be with the hands humid, and be administered movement of the member to all parts at all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if crookedness already is gone before and is made strong and converted is in worse and provoked is necessity to cure of it with iron, then you must have it the most desus ceased and the continuation of the bone be dissolved, and be incisor that superfluous of nodule of that meteys with the bone with subtle incisors, and be administered facility in that with solicitude and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of the speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any of the joints of the body, so that it is prohibited from movement, and the figure of the limb is altered, and it brings great pains and injuries to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an accident occurs to any dislocation, it is necessary to immediately try to reduce it, and not delay that reduction, for if it is delayed, the place becomes inflamed and very difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, it is not advisable to be bad or stretched during the time of inflammation, for many times it brings spasms and terrible pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, it is necessary that you take care of the patient's groin, and let it rest while the inflammation subsides; and then the limb should be wrapped with warm water and oil, and then it should be reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all member should be cured with that which the remembrance will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the chapters of dislocation according to what precedes in fracture; from the part of the body more sovereign to the part less so.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So the two jaws are dislocated if they are not treated; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: that they are slightly displaced from their places and softened a little; or they are dislocated by a complete dislocation and complicated, so that they are softened at the junction where the saliva of the patient flows and that he cannot hold it or close his mouth, and his tongue is enveloped in his word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of it is slight, then in the major dispositions it returns by itself with little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is complete and complicated, then it is necessary that a reduction of it be administered gently, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister has the head of the patient, and the doctor inserts his thumb of one hand into the root of the dislocation of the lower jaw from inside his mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or that he inserts his two thumbs together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers of his hands are outside with which he supports; and he commands the patient to cease his jaws and allow them to move from each side; and the doctor pushes the jaw and pushes the jaw until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if it is difficult to reduce it, and especially if both jaws are dislocated at the same time, then administer vaporization with warm water and oil, until a lighter reduction of both is made and the reduction of both is not delayed at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And therefore, when they return and are set, and the mouth of the patient is closed and is not softened, then place on them powders of cloth with cerot, and it is made of wax and oil rubbed; and it is applied with ease with soft bandages.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head be standing between two pillows, so that he does not strain either to the right or to the left; and do not let him chew for any cause; having his food be forbidden for a long time, until the pains are reduced and the jaws are healed, then let him chew what he wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with ease, and do not work on the opening of the mouth for eating and drinking and speaking, until the jaw is healed and sound.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce two jaws when they are dislocated in any hour and are not returned to their places, then many times this happens fever and persistent diarrhea, and very much the belly of the patient is affected, and very much and pure yellow bile is vomited.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then you know that it is pernicious; and many times he dies to whom this happens within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the clavicle and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The clavicle is not dislocated from the place from between by its continuation with the foot; and sometimes it is dislocated at the outer part, and this is declared to the touch.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then grasp the place with your palm with great force, so that it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then place on that plaster and powder and strengthen that.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which is joined and continued to it, is not dislocated in any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and set according to what we have said and according to what is to your arrangement.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place on that plaster, and powder, and strapping, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this same cure is reduced the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated from the part of the thigh to the part below.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated from the part above the muscle, and this is done hard; and it is not dislocated to the parts behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated to the parts in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and pushed out to the parts below the thigh, and mostly in those whose flesh is little, it is easily dislocated; but in those in which there is much flesh, it is pushed out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often accidents happen to some men by percussion or fall, and the muscle of them is inflamed with an abscess cautery, and it is cured by that which it is already dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, it is necessary that you know this before you are over-certain of it, and then you will proceed in the cure of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of it is when it is in the parts below the thigh; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy muscle, for you find between those manifest diversity; and you find in the head of the muscle concavity and below the thigh of the touch of the head of the muscle as if a bowl, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his ear, nor move it in any way.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the foot or above, and then you find manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation is made light reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister elevates his hand to the parts above; and then places his thumbs below the thigh of him, and elevates the joint with strength upwards to its place, and the minister elevates his hand, and extends that upwards; and then places that below where it returns slightly.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by what we have said it does not return, and it is from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, many days, then it is necessary that the patient be bathed in lukewarm water and be administered a poultice that softens and liniments as if it were made of  coytz, rue, fennel, and melilot in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient be laid on his back and be placed below the thigh of him, waiting for a pad that is between light and tightness, and the physician places his heel on the sphere, and elevates the head of the muscle with virtue, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not bad to the parts below, and another minister holds the head of the patient so that it is not bad to the parts below, for that instantly returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it in this way: and it is that you make present a man who is longer than the patient, and stands on that side, and interlaces his muscle below the thigh of the patient and elevates his thigh to the parts above while the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the parts below his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then it is necessary that with him that another cause be suspended, so that it is heavy, for the dislocation returns instantly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced easily in another way: and it is that a long rod be placed on the ground, the head of which is round in figure, as if a mortar, that it is not thick nor thin, and then it is placed below the patient; because on the head of the rod are placed lion cloths, and the patient stands according to the length of the rod, and then the hand of him is extended to the parts below the other part; and the body of him is extended from the other part with strength, for the joint returns to its place with speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult reduction of it for all the causes that we have said, then use of this cure: and it is that you take a rod the quantity of which is in the length of two arms, and the width of it is of four digits, and the thickness of it is adjusted in the preon of the thigh according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And on the round head are placed lion cloths so that the rod does not hurt the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then it is placed below the thigh of the patient, and the hand or arm is extended over the rod into the parts below, and the rod is tied over the assistant and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed on a step of a ladder according to the width, and the hand is extended to the parts below, and the other body is suspended from the other part, for the joint enters instantly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And as the entering of it is completed in any manner that is possible to you, then it is necessary that you place below the thigh a pad of wool of equal quantity; and then place a plaster prepared of powder of molli with eggs and album of hen over the whole muscle, so that it is rolled upwards, and then strength below the thigh with decent tightness; and the bandage is rolled over the plaster, and the hand of him is attached to the neck of him, and it is left, and the hand of him is not moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the food of the patient be little, while the limb is comforted, for it is more light to the healing of it.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given more around the seventh or fifth and an exercise is carried out; and therefore if it is stopped and not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times by humidity that happens to it or by another cause, then it is necessary that in that one be administered cautery with three trauchs, according to that which is said before in the chapter of cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after seven days the ligament is loosened and the joint is not fixed, and the plaster and the strapping are reduced over it several times, and it is not fixed and catz and cannot raise that arm to the upper parts, then know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already severed or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Of the dislocation of that which is made of the foot and the thigh or the parts behind, the reduction is made with impulse and extension with the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another strapping should be administered in that, and care should be taken of that until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it happens that near the healing gravity falls in the limb and slowness in the movement of it, then the patient uses baths many times until that gravity is alleviated and that it returns to its first nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .xxvii.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and seemingly returns with difficulty; and that is dislocated to all parts, and mostly to the front part to the back part, and the dislocation of it is not disguised to you, because it is evident by the movement or by the touch according to which figure it is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip with the hand, that is to you declared manifestly, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch with that its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you must cover those hips, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it comes to a cautery abscess, because if it comes to a cautery abscess, the reduction is difficult, and it is not healed of all; and especially when it is in the back parts, because it is worse of all the other kinds of dislocation, and of greater pain, and many times they die from it.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when that is possible to reduce, is that the hand of it be extended with two hands, and the arm of it be expanded, and the hands of the physician be upon the hip and below it, and he pushes the joint with the knuckles of his hands together, or with the root of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns as if it bends the hand with its hand, until it strikes the hip with the root of its palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vehement extension and strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that raising of the ministers so that it not be retracted from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And about it be revolved the arm of all parts, because it is enveloped in a long folded cloth over the hand of it, or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint that with some oil so that that be those causes which help in the lubrication of the joint with facility; and about it pushes the joint with a vehement impulse until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And after the reduction of it, it is necessary that it be placed upon that plaster in which there is sticking and padding with album of egg, and it be extended with a descending strapping, and the arm be suspended from the collar, and be left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And after it is loosened; and therefore if the joint is formed in its place, then you loosen the ligament of it and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if sometimes the joint does not become stronger, then you reiterate the plaster and the ligament, and leave it for some days until it is extended; and after it is loosened.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to it gravity after the reduction of the joint, and the disposition of it is in movement, then administer moisture in baths and subtle friction, and compression, until it is alleviated; or pause upon the junction alleviated, so it is a matter of heavy motion; and about it be bound, and leave it over the bones the day and the night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And about it is placed, and put that in bath; and when it dries, then you rub the joint with temperate friction, and about it reiterate upon that alleviated, so it is a matter of motion, once, and the second, and the third.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already reached the tooth inside the mouth, while it is still lined.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause upon that cleft of wet cow and scalded with border and strengthen upon it; and do that some times, because that is wet and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure of dislocation of the malassen, so it is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Malassen of the hand some times is dislocated, and the reduction of the dislocation of it is lighter, and the contrary is of the other joints, but however it is necessary that it be velocity in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is dislocated, before the place is apostematized or that it happens in it apostema caut.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation of that is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and the minister extends the hand of that, and the doctor places his hand or his palm on the prominence of the joint, and pushes it inward until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however, it must be considered if the palm is already placed in the belly of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand on a table, over the extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is precedent, then the back of the hand, so that the position of the hand of that intrinsically on the table, so that the doctor's hand lies on that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore if it returns immediately, it is good; and if not, then strengthen that with a poultice, yielding the abscess and leaving it; and do not repeat this, for if not, do not suffer nor can you on the reduction of it more than days pass by it.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however, the joint remains according to its tortuosity; and do not put any cause to the patient, except that the hand is softened and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are broken or cut, and then there is no other way than to strengthen it with a cautery near the place of it and strongly do this, conferring any cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the bad limb is returned, then place on it the poultice which have you recomposed, and let it be left and strengthened for five days; and then it is removed and left, and the hand of it is exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is stayed and any gravity falls on it, then gently that with water and friction several times, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure of dislocations of the said.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the fingers are dislocated in every part.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger is dislocated of those at the back of the palm or in the belly of it, then stretch the finger and push the dislocation of it with your thumbs, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend that part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend it until straight it is healed in that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, bind that according to that narration, and do not cease to unbind that in the day and exercise with movement, and bind that at night; and do this for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly with this, if it is dislocated in the belly of the hand, and bind that to that part and do with this your first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do with this when it is dislocated in the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocations of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a dislocation complicated of any of the vertebrae of the back or of the neck occurs, and the movable vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that there is no cure, for death takes hold of the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the digestion of the patient is outside his will, and he cannot retain that; and many times are softened some limbs of him or both legs of him or both arms of him, or one of those; or a vertebra is removed from its place, for many times it is removed and many times the removal of those in four parts is made.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, that is already removed to the parts behind and is called gelbositis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure of it is that then you consider if the gelbositis occurs from puerility, for then in that there is no cure nor from that there is healing of all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that which comes from a blow or percussion or similar to those, the Ancients already said the ways of cure with verbose sermons, of which the most returns with prophecy; but I have already shortened it from that of which the little excuse of the too much of it, for my better proximity to the better understanding exposition, with which I have this exposed and formed from diverse instruments of that with which I will show this and expose that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gelbositis that occurs from the front part in the feet, there is no way nor healing of that; and similarly in that which is made at two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except that which occurs in the back properly with that which I have recomposed.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And that the patient be extended on his face, with one arm propped near a wall, and the other arm stretched out below him so that the feet of him are not lifted.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick be placed, stuck in the ground at the extremity of the arm near the head of it, and another stick in the opposite extremity of the arm, holding the feet of him.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister holds the stick, and it is not held in a ditch; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
